alert.note: Alert for Crisp; Dooly; Macon; Sumter (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 4:43AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Macon, western Pulaski, Dooly, southwestern Bleckley, southern Houston, eastern Sumter and northwestern Crisp Counties through 515 AM EDT... At 442 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Dooling to near Methvins to Smithville, and moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Americus, Cordele, Cochran, Hawkinsville, Vienna, Oglethorpe, Unadilla, Montezuma, Byromville, Pinehurst, Leslie, Andersonville, Lilly, De Soto, Dooling, Desoto, Cobb, Sumter, Lamar and Browndale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
